intro: Dipteranthus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered dipteranthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and numerous stamens, and bloom throughout the wet season. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
